thread.title: South Summit wins rivalry game, 17-7 over North Summit to clinch region
thread.title_full: South Summit wins rivalry game, 17-7 over North Summit to clinch region

title: South Summit wins rivalry game, 17-7 over North Summit to clinch region
text:
South Summit wins rivalry game, 17-7 over North Summit to clinch region By Sean Walker | Posted Oct 15th, 2015 @ 11:02pm 0  10PM: South Summit wins rivalry game over North Summit 
KAMAS — Parker Grajek's touchdown pass with 36 seconds left in the third quarter gave South Summit a 17-0 lead with 36 seconds left in the third, helping the Wildcats claim a 17-7 win over rival North Summit to clinch at least a share of the Class 2A North region title Thursday. 
The Wildcats (9-0, 5-0 2A North) also guaranteed themselves the No. 1 seed from the 2A North in the Class 2A state playoffs in two weeks. 
Grajek executed a near-flawless halfback pass on the reverse to Isaac Tillett, who scampered 38 yards and dived across the end zone in the end of the third quarter to give the Wildcats a 17-0 lead over their heated rival. 
After a 3-0 halftime lead, Brady Bess scored the first touchdown of the night for South Summit with a five-yard scoring plunge with five minutes remaining in the third to go up 10-0. 
North Summit's Braxten Northrup scored on a 1-yard dive into the end zone with three minutes left in the game to pull within 17-7, but the Braves (6-3, 4-1 2A North) could get no closer. 
South Summit finishes the season next week against Beaver, which beat North Sevier 48-0 to move to 8-1 on the season and 4-0 in the 2A South. 
Contributing : Rod Zundel
